chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall a b d1 d2 : Z, is_gcdZ a b d1 -> is_gcdZ a b d2 -> d2 = d1

Premises:
Inductive is_gcdZ : Z -> Z -> Z -> Prop := gcd_OZ : forall b : Z, is_gcdZ OZ b (absZ b) | gcd_mod : forall b a d q r : Z, b <> OZ -> is_diveuclZ a b q r -> is_gcdZ r b d -> is_gcdZ b a d
Inductive Z : Set := OZ : Z | pos : nat -> Z | neg : nat -> Z Arguments pos _%nat_scope Arguments neg _%nat_scope
gcd_unicity_apart_sign : forall a b d1 d2 : Z, is_gcd Z IdZ multZ OZ a b d1 -> is_gcd Z IdZ multZ OZ a b d2 -> d2 = d1 \/ d2 = oppZ d1
gcd_unicity_apart_unities : forall (S : Set) (A : S -> Prop) (Add Mult : S -> S -> S) (O I : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_unitary_commutative_ring S A Add Mult O I Opp -> integrity S Mult O -> forall a b d1 d2 : S, is_gcd S A Mult O a b d1 -> is_gcd S A Mult O a b d2 -> exists x : S, inversible S Mult I x /\ A x /\ d2 = Mult d1 x
gcdZ_i : forall a b x : Z, is_gcdZ a b x -> {x : Z | is_gcdZ a b x}
gcd_mod : forall b a d q r : Z, b <> OZ -> is_diveuclZ a b q r -> is_gcdZ r b d -> is_gcdZ b a d
gcdZ_is_gcd : forall a b d : Z, is_gcdZ a b d -> is_gcd Z IdZ multZ OZ a b d
positive_is_gcdZ : forall a b d : Z, is_gcdZ a b d -> leZ OZ d
gcdZ_correct : forall a b : Z, is_gcdZ a b (gcdZ a b)
is_gcdZ_sind : forall P : Z -> Z -> Z -> SProp, (forall b : Z, P OZ b (absZ b)) -> (forall b a d q r : Z, b <> OZ -> is_diveuclZ a b q r -> is_gcdZ r b d -> P r b d -> P b a d) -> forall z z0 z1 : Z, is_gcdZ z z0 z1 -> P z z0 z1
is_gcdZ_ind : forall P : Z -> Z -> Z -> Prop, (forall b : Z, P OZ b (absZ b)) -> (forall b a d q r : Z, b <> OZ -> is_diveuclZ a b q r -> is_gcdZ r b d -> P r b d -> P b a d) -> forall z z0 z1 : Z, is_gcdZ z z0 z1 -> P z z0 z1
have_gcdZ = fun a b : Z => {d : Z | is_gcdZ a b d} : Z -> Z -> Set
divZ : forall a b : Z, b <> OZ -> diveuclZ a b
divexZ : forall a b q r : Z, is_diveuclZ a b q r -> diveuclZ a b
BinInt.Z.bits_inj' : forall a b : BinNums.Z, (forall n : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 n -> BinInt.Z.testbit a n = BinInt.Z.testbit b n) -> a = b
P = fun a : Z => forall b : Z, have_gcdZ a b : Z -> Set
Znumtheory.Euclid_intro : forall a b u v d : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.mul u a) (BinInt.Z.mul v b) = d -> Znumtheory.Zis_gcd a b d -> Znumtheory.Euclid a b
diveucl_rec : forall (a b : nat) (P : diveucl a b -> Set), (forall (q r : nat) (g : b > r) (e : a = q * b + r), P (divex a b q r g e)) -> forall d : diveucl a b, P d
Inductive diveuclZ (a b : Z) : Set := divexZ : forall q r : Z, is_diveuclZ a b q r -> diveuclZ a b
diveuclZ_sind : forall (a b : Z) (P : diveuclZ a b -> SProp), (forall (q r : Z) (i : is_diveuclZ a b q r), P (divexZ a b q r i)) -> forall d : diveuclZ a b, P d
diveuclZ_ind : forall (a b : Z) (P : diveuclZ a b -> Prop), (forall (q r : Z) (i : is_diveuclZ a b q r), P (divexZ a b q r i)) -> forall d : diveuclZ a b, P d
diveuclZ_rec : forall (a b : Z) (P : diveuclZ a b -> Set), (forall (q r : Z) (i : is_diveuclZ a b q r), P (divexZ a b q r i)) -> forall d : diveuclZ a b, P d
diveuclZ_rect : forall (a b : Z) (P : diveuclZ a b -> Type), (forall (q r : Z) (i : is_diveuclZ a b q r), P (divexZ a b q r i)) -> forall d : diveuclZ a b, P d
gcd_OZ : forall b : Z, is_gcdZ OZ b (absZ b)
gcdZ_exists : forall a b : Z, have_gcdZ a b
Znumtheory.Euclid_rect : forall (a b : BinNums.Z) (P : Znumtheory.Euclid a b -> Type), (forall (u v d : BinNums.Z) (e : BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.mul u a) (BinInt.Z.mul v b) = d) (z : Znumtheory.Zis_gcd a b d), P (Znumtheory.Euclid_intro a b u v d e z)) -> forall e : Znumtheory.Euclid a b, P e
Znumtheory.Euclid_rec : forall (a b : BinNums.Z) (P : Znumtheory.Euclid a b -> Set), (forall (u v d : BinNums.Z) (e : BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.mul u a) (BinInt.Z.mul v b) = d) (z : Znumtheory.Zis_gcd a b d), P (Znumtheory.Euclid_intro a b u v d e z)) -> forall e : Znumtheory.Euclid a b, P e
Inductive diveucl (a b : nat) : Set := divex : forall q r : nat, b > r -> a = q * b + r -> diveucl a b Arguments diveucl (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments divex (_ _ _ _)%nat_scope
is_diveuclZ = fun a b q r : Z => b <> OZ /\ leZ OZ r /\ ltZ r (absZ b) /\ a = addZ (multZ b q) r : Z -> Z -> Z -> Z -> Prop
gcdZ = fun a b : Z => pi1 Z (is_gcdZ a b) (gcdZ_exists a b) : Z -> Z -> Z
Inductive Zis_gcd (a b g : BinNums.Z) : Prop := Zis_gcd_intro : BinInt.Z.divide g a -> BinInt.Z.divide g b -> (forall x : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.divide x a -> BinInt.Z.divide x b -> BinInt.Z.divide x g) -> Znumtheory.Zis_gcd a b g Arguments Znumtheory.Zis_gcd (_ _ _)%Z_scope Arguments Znumtheory.Zis_gcd_intro (_ _ _)%Z_scope _ _ _%function_scope
Inductive Euclid (a b : BinNums.Z) : Set := Euclid_intro : forall u v d : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.mul u a) (BinInt.Z.mul v b) = d -> Znumtheory.Zis_gcd a b d -> Znumtheory.Euclid a b Arguments Znumtheory.Euclid (_ _)%Z_scope Arguments Znumtheory.Euclid_intro (_ _ _ _ _)%Z_scope
Znumtheory.Bezout_sind : forall (a b d : BinNums.Z) (P : SProp), (forall u v : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.mul u a) (BinInt.Z.mul v b) = d -> P) -> Znumtheory.Bezout a b d -> P
div_mult : forall (S : Set) (A : S -> Prop) (Add Mult : S -> S -> S) (O : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_ring S A Add Mult O Opp -> forall a b d : S, divide S A Mult O d a -> A b -> divide S A Mult O d (Mult a b)
div_add : forall (S : Set) (A : S -> Prop) (Add Mult : S -> S -> S) (O : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_ring S A Add Mult O Opp -> forall a b d : S, divide S A Mult O d a -> divide S A Mult O d b -> divide S A Mult O d (Add a b)
integrityZ = fun a b : Z => Z_rec (fun a0 : Z => multZ a0 b = OZ -> {a0 = OZ} + {b = OZ}) (fun _ : multZ OZ b = OZ => left eq_refl) (fun (n : nat) (H : multZ (pos n) b = OZ) => right (tech_integ_posZ n b H)) (fun (n : nat) (H : multZ (neg n) b = OZ) => right (tech_integ_negZ n b H)) a : integrity Z multZ OZ
Inductive Bezout (a b d : BinNums.Z) : Prop := Bezout_intro : forall u v : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.mul u a) (BinInt.Z.mul v b) = d -> Znumtheory.Bezout a b d Arguments Znumtheory.Bezout (_ _ _)%Z_scope Arguments Znumtheory.Bezout_intro (_ _ _ _ _)%Z_scope
BinInt.Z.lnot_spec : forall a n : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 n -> BinInt.Z.testbit (BinInt.Z.lnot a) n = negb (BinInt.Z.testbit a n)
Bool.negb_involutive : forall b : bool, negb (negb b) = b
gcd_OZ_absZ : forall b : Z, is_gcd Z IdZ multZ OZ OZ b (absZ b)
BinInt.Z.lnot_involutive : forall a : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lnot (BinInt.Z.lnot a) = a
and_set_set_set_rec : forall (S1 S2 : Set) (P : and_set_set_set S1 S2 -> Set), (forall (s : S2) (s0 : S1), P (and_set_set_set_i S1 S2 s s0)) -> forall a : and_set_set_set S1 S2, P a

```intros a b d1 d2 H1 H2.
inversion H1; inversion H2; subst.
- reflexivity.
- assert (d2 = x0) as H_eq.
  + apply (gcd_unicity_apart_unities _ _ _ OZ); assumption.
  + rewrite H_eq. reflexivity.
```

original: intros a b d1 d2 H1 H2. inversion H1; inversion H2; subst. - reflexivity. - assert (d2 = x0) as H_eq. + apply (gcd_unicity_apart_unities _ _ _ OZ); auto. + rewrite H_eq. reflexivity.
